"Map with objects" Analytical dashboard
The "Map with objects" analytical dashboard allows users to display necessary map markers on the dashboard profile.
To set up the "Map with objects" analytical dashboard in the
dashboard
profile, a
data source
must be added in the visual editing mode.
Adding the "Map with objects" analytical dashboard to the
dashboard
profile is done in visual editing mode. Drag & Drop the "Map with objects" element from the "Elements" panel to the working area of the dashboard profile located under the "Dashboards" tab.
Further configuration is available via the
button, which opens the "settings of map with objects" modal window.
Configuration parameters
Main parameters
Setting
Purpose
Name
Title of the analytical dashboard.
Container height, %
Setting the height of the analytical dashboard.
The height is defined as a percentage of the screen height.
The default value is 40%.
View of the card being opened
Defining a type of profile opened when clicking a map marker. Possible values:
Custom object card – the object profile opens in a modal window by the code specified in the "Source ID field" parameter.
An object visual can be selected if needed;
Specialized booking card – opens a location profile that allows access to the booking profile.
This option allows selecting the
"Booking"
dashboard element.
The default value is "Custom object card".
This button provides access to the object type visual selection, which is displayed when clicking the map marker.
If no visual is selected, the default visual is displayed upon clicking the marker.
The button is available when the "Custom object card" option is selected for the "View of the card being opened" field.
Booking element of dashboard
Selecting the
"Booking"
dashboard element to display the location profile when clicking the map marker.
This field is available when the "Specialized booking card" option is selected for the "View of the card being opened" field.
Example of a location profile when using the "Booking" analytical dashboard
Type of map
Defining the map type. Possible values:
Google;
Yandex;
OpenStreetMap.
The default value is "OpenStreetMap".
API key
API key entry field.
Available when the "Google" or "Yandex" map type is selected.
Data source
Selecting the
data source
for displaying objects on the map.
Select from a dropdown list of sources added to the dashboard profile.
This field is required.
Source latitude field
Defining the field containing object latitude information.
Select from a dropdown list of all fields in the selected data source.
This field is required.
Source longitude field
Defining the field containing object longitude information.
Select from a dropdown list of all fields in the selected data source.
This field is required.
Source icon field
Defining the field containing object icon information.
Select from a dropdown list of all fields in the selected data source.
This field is required.
Source ID field
Defining the field containing the object code.
Select from a dropdown list of all fields in the selected data source.
This field is required.
Additional parameters
To display only objects within the visible map area, the following dashboard parameters should be set:
Setting
Purpose
Setting current latitude dashboard
Selecting a previously created
control element
of the "Number" type that transmits the user’s current latitude.
A dashboard parameter must be created beforehand to link to the control element.
Setting current longitude dashboard
Selecting a previously created
control element
of the "Number" type that transmits the user’s current longitude.
A dashboard parameter must be created beforehand to link to the control element.
Latitude of the lower left border dashboard
Selecting a previously created
control element
of the "Number" type that transmits the latitude of the lower left border of the visible map area.
A dashboard parameter must be created beforehand to link to the control element.
Longitude of the lower left border dashboard
Selecting a previously created
control element
of the "Number" type that transmits the longitude of the lower left border of the visible map area.
A dashboard parameter must be created beforehand to link to the control element.
Latitude of the upper right border dashboard
Selecting a previously created
control element
of the "Number" type that transmits the latitude of the upper right border of the visible map area.
A dashboard parameter must be created beforehand to link to the control element.
Longitude of the upper right dashboard
Selecting a previously created
control element
of the "Number" type that transmits the longitude of the upper right border of the visible map area.
A dashboard parameter must be created beforehand to link to the control element.
Search parameter location
Selecting a previously created
control element
of the "String" type that transmits a search string for quick map navigation.
A dashboard parameter must be created beforehand to link to the control element.
Result
After saving the analytical dashboard settings and dashboard profile visual, the configured panel will be displayed on the user’s screen.
A detailed example of configuring the "Map with objects" and "Booking" analytical dashboards is given
here
.
